trans-unit.source: Create a Pass-Through Bridge
trans-unit.target: Create a Pass-Through Bridge

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>passthru</token> as part of a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>passthru</token> as part of a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: A <token>passthru</token> has only one stage, the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.
trans-unit.target: A <token>passthru</token> has only one stage, the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instruction on how to configure each of these stages.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instruction on how to configure each of these stages.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the steps to configure a <token>passthru</token> are:
trans-unit.target: Typically, the steps to configure a <token>passthru</token> are:

trans-unit.source: Add a <token>passthru</token> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Add a <token>passthru</token> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Enrich stage of the <token>passthru</token>.
trans-unit.target: Configure the Enrich stage of the <token>passthru</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add a <token>passthru</token> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>
trans-unit.target: To add a <token>passthru</token> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, as described in <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, as described in <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>passthru</token></embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>passthru</token></embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: This adds a <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file to the solution.
trans-unit.target: This adds a <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file to the solution.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <token>passthru</token> component, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and then enter the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <token>passthru</token> component, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and then enter the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Associated Project Item
trans-unit.target: Associated Project Item

trans-unit.source: The name of the associated .BridgeConfig file.
trans-unit.target: The name of the associated .BridgeConfig file.

trans-unit.source: This is a read-only field, which means that you cannot edit this property to change the name of the .BridgeConfig file.
trans-unit.target: This is a read-only field, which means that you cannot edit this property to change the name of the .BridgeConfig file.

trans-unit.source: To change the name of the file, you must change the entity name, as defined for the next property, <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To change the name of the file, you must change the entity name, as defined for the next property, <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: The name of the <token>passthru</token> component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: The name of the <token>passthru</token> component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: This name should be unique for a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This name should be unique for a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file is the same as the entity name you enter here.
trans-unit.target: The name of the <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file is the same as the entity name you enter here.

trans-unit.source: Relative Address
trans-unit.target: Relative Address

trans-unit.source: The relative address where the <token>passthru</token> is hosted on <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: The relative address where the <token>passthru</token> is hosted on <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: This address along with the <token>af_integration</token> URL you entered in Step 2 is used to create the complete URL for the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: This address along with the <token>af_integration</token> URL you entered in Step 2 is used to create the complete URL for the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the <token>af_integration</token> URL is <embeddedLabel>MyBizTalkService</embeddedLabel> and the relative address of the <token>bridge</token> is <embeddedLabel>PassThruBridge</embeddedLabel>, the URL for the endpoint on the <token>sb2</token> is <legacyItalic>https://MyBizTalkService.biztalk.windows.net/default/PassThruBridge</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the <token>af_integration</token> URL is <embeddedLabel>MyBizTalkService</embeddedLabel> and the relative address of the <token>bridge</token> is <embeddedLabel>PassThruBridge</embeddedLabel>, the URL for the endpoint on the <token>sb2</token> is <legacyItalic>https://MyBizTalkService.biztalk.windows.net/default/PassThruBridge</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Route Ordering Table
trans-unit.target: Route Ordering Table

trans-unit.source: Specifies the routing order of the message from the <token>passthru</token> to other components of the message flow.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the routing order of the message from the <token>passthru</token> to other components of the message flow.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0#BKMK_Order" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">The Routing Order</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0#BKMK_Order" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">The Routing Order</link>.

trans-unit.source: Runtime Address
trans-unit.target: Runtime Address

trans-unit.source: The public runtime endpoint URL where the bridge is deployed.
trans-unit.target: The public runtime endpoint URL where the bridge is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Track Properties
trans-unit.target: Track Properties

trans-unit.source: You can set this property to define which properties on the message are tracked by the bridge.
trans-unit.target: You can set this property to define which properties on the message are tracked by the bridge.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to set this property, see <link xlink:href="04a41fee-5705-43d1-8ee3-2b78e130a3ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages Processed by the Bridge</link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to set this property, see <link xlink:href="04a41fee-5705-43d1-8ee3-2b78e130a3ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages Processed by the Bridge</link>.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Enrich Stage
trans-unit.target: Configure the Enrich Stage

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage enables message enrichment by defining properties, the values for which can be derived from the message header (standard or custom), from system-promoted properties (default properties promoted by the <token>bridge</token>), or from an external data source (only <token>ssSDSfull</token> tables supported in this release).
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage enables message enrichment by defining properties, the values for which can be derived from the message header (standard or custom), from system-promoted properties (default properties promoted by the <token>bridge</token>), or from an external data source (only <token>ssSDSfull</token> tables supported in this release).

trans-unit.source: These properties can then be used to either route the message to a destination endpoint or for further processing by the message receiving entity.
trans-unit.target: These properties can then be used to either route the message to a destination endpoint or for further processing by the message receiving entity.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we go through the procedures for performing each of these actions, namely:
trans-unit.target: In this section, we go through the procedures for performing each of these actions, namely:

trans-unit.source: Assigning message header values to properties
trans-unit.target: Assigning message header values to properties

trans-unit.source: Using system-promoted properties
trans-unit.target: Using system-promoted properties

trans-unit.source: Looking up an external data source
trans-unit.target: Looking up an external data source

trans-unit.source: To configure the Enrich stage
trans-unit.target: To configure the Enrich stage

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>passthru</token> component to open the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>passthru</token> component to open the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, set the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, set the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to include any custom code that must be executed before the message enters the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: If you want to include any custom code that must be executed before the message enters the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if you want to include any custom code that must be executed after the message exits the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, if you want to include any custom code that must be executed after the message exits the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: For more information, on how to set these properties, see <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, on how to set these properties, see <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane click the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> window.
trans-unit.target: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity, and then from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane click the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> window.
